Shelters.name: Gignoo Aboriginal Transition House
Shelters.description: Support for First Nation women and children who are survivors of domestic violence

Shelters.name: Grace House for Women
Shelters.description: Temporary Housing with support from resident support workers and a transition planner

Shelters.name: Outflow Men's Shelter
Shelters.description: 24/7 free-of-charge shelter with 30 beds, provides a light meal, showers, laundry, and breakfast

Shelters.name: Saint John House
Shelters.description: Downtown emergency shelter to up to 27 individuals, offering laundry and showering services, a resident phone, Wi-Fi, computers, access to donation, and support from Resident Support Workers, a Transition Planner and Manager

Shelters.name: Sanctuary House
Shelters.description: Temporary housing for women and children who are victims of domestic violence

Shelters.name: Women in Transition
Shelters.description: Shelter for women who have experienced domestic and intimate partner violence, provides accommodations for up to 19 women and their children for a period of up to 30 days

Rehabilitation.name: Youth Impact Jeunesse
Rehabilitation.description: Offers residential services for youths between two and twenty-five, as well as outreach programs for youths aged 16 or older

Rehabilitation.name: Naomi & Ruth
Rehabilitation.description: Faith-based one year program offering a supportive environment with  medical treatment, therapy, mentorship, financial counseling, fitness programs, stress management, and life skills training

Rehabilitation.name: Teen Challenge
Rehabilitation.description: 12-month in-residence alcohol and drug addiction rehabilitation programs for adults 18 or older

Rehabilitation.name: Village of Hope
Rehabilitation.description: 10-month Christianity-based program centred on drug and alcohol addiction recovery

FirstNationsResources.name: Elsipogtog Health & Wellness Centre
FirstNationsResources.description: Wellness center focusing on providing holistic health and wellness services

FirstNationsResources.name: Rising Sun Treatment Centre
FirstNationsResources.description: Culturally-based and harm reduction-focused addiction services with on-site mental health counsellors, a range of therapeutic one-on-one and group interventions, our in-house Addictions counsellors include both the Seeking Safety program and Smart Recovery program in daily sessions

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Fredericton Legal Advice Clinic
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Run by volunteer lawyers providing advice in person or through online contact form

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Investigations of Complaints - Employment Standards
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Handles employment-related complaints, with officers screening and investigating issues that may escalate to the New Brunswick Labour & Employment Board

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Landlord and Tenant Relations Office
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Provides information and resources on rental agreements, dispute resolution, and the Residential Tenancies Act

LegalAndReferralServices.name: New Brunswick Human Rights Commission
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Government agency responsible for administering the Human Rights Act, promoting equality, and eliminating discriminatory practices

LegalAndReferralServices.name: New Brunswick Legal Aid Services Commission (NBLASC)
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Provides legal representation for child support and child custody for qualifying individuals

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Family Law Advice Lawyer
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Offers up to two hours of assistance for family law paperwork and basic advice

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Public Legal Education Information Services NB (PLEIS)
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Provides family law information line and legal information line

LegalAndReferralServices.name: New Brunswick Real Estate Association (NBREA)
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Provincial association of REALTORSÂ® working to promote professional standards and protect public interest

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Stewart McKelvey - Will Project
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Partnership with UNB Law and Pro Bono students to create wills for people of limited means

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Public Trustee
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Assistance for individuals like seniors or disabled persons regarding legal capacity

LegalAndReferralServices.name: NB Refugee Clinic
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Assists with Basis of Claim forms, immigration hearings, and related refugee issues

LegalAndReferralServices.name: Fine Option Program
LegalAndReferralServices.description: Allows young or adult offenders to do volunteer work in lieu of paying a monetary fine
